title: Hedge Fund Heiress Selling Manhattan Co-Op for $7 Million
text:
The daughter of billionaire hedge fund manager Izzy Englander is selling an elegant duplex on the Upper East Side, Mansion Global has learned.



The south-facing co-op apartment overlooks the city from the top two floors of a limestone palazzo-style building completed over 100 years ago, according to the listing, which hit the market earlier this month for $6.995 million.



More: Manhattan’s Co-Op Market Had Best Week Since City Mansion Tax Hike

Laura Englander Levin, a dermatologist and an heir to Mr. Englander’s $6 billion-plus fortune, is selling the home for a notch below what she paid for the unit back in 2008, according to property records. She bought it through a trust in the spring of that year for $7.5 million, records show.



The spacious 11-room apartment features hardwood floors, a spacious eat-in kitchen and multiple staff rooms, according to the listing with Wendy Greenbaum of Warburg Realty, who declined to comment.



A decade-old listing from before Ms. Englander Levin’s time shows that she and her husband, author Daniel Levin, have since updated the interiors, opting for a pared-down natural color palette over the wallpaper and tchotchkes favored by the previous owner. Ms. Englander Levin could not immediately be reached for comment.



The main entrance on the 10th floor opens into an airy foyer with doorways to the home’s numerous living rooms—which include an additional den, library and dining room—and a sweeping staircase to the second level.



Four bedrooms, including an en-suite master, spread across the home’s second level, in addition to two staff rooms, “which could easily be combined to create a fifth large bedroom,” the listing says.



The buyer will have to put down at least half up front, as the exclusive co-op building allows only 50% mortgage financing, according to the listing.

It’s the second lavish Manhattan home Ms. Englander Levin has decided to part with in the last three years. She sold a five-bedroom unit in another posh Upper East Side building in 2016 for $13.1 million, property records show.



Ms. Englander Levin is one of three children of Israel “Izzy” Englander, founder of Millennium Management. Mr. Englander led real estates news in 2014 when he paid a record-breaking $71.3 million for an Upper East Side co-op, Mansion Global previously reported. A spokesman for Mr. Englander's fund declined to comment.
